name: df-evls
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6, setvar s7
body: |- wceq(ces, cmpo(s0, s1, universe, ccrg, csb(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s1)), cmpt(s3, cfv(csubrg, cv(s1)), csb(s4, co(cv(s0), cmpl, co(cv(s1), cress, cv(s3))), crio(s5, co(cv(s4), crh, co(cv(s1), cpws, co(cv(s2), cmap, cv(s0)))), wa(wceq(ccom(cv(s5), cfv(cascl, cv(s4))), cmpt(s6, cv(s3), cxp(co(cv(s2), cmap, cv(s0)), csn(cv(s6))))), wceq(ccom(cv(s5), co(cv(s0), cmvr, co(cv(s1), cress, cv(s3)))), cmpt(s6, cv(s0), cmpt(s7, co(cv(s2), cmap, cv(s0)), cfv(cv(s7), cv(s6))))))))))))
bodyPretty: âŠ¢ evalSub =(s0 âˆˆ ð•Œ, s1 âˆˆ CRing â†¦[(Base ` s1)/ s2](s3 âˆˆ(SubRing ` s1)â†¦[(s0[mPoly](s1[|`s]s3))/ s4]iota(s5 âˆˆ(s4[RingHom](s1[^](s2[â†¦]s0))),((s5 âˆ˜(algSc ` s4))=(s6 âˆˆ s3 â†¦((s2[â†¦]s0)Ã— { s6 }))âˆ§(s5 âˆ˜(s0[mVar](s1[|`s]s3)))=(s6 âˆˆ s0 â†¦(s7 âˆˆ(s2[â†¦]s0)â†¦(s7 ` s6)))))))
comment: Define the evaluation map for the polynomial algebra. The function ` ( ( I evalSub S ) `` R ) : V --> ( S ^m ( S ^m I ) ) ` makes sense when ` I ` is an index set, ` S ` is a ring, ` R ` is a subring of ` S ` , and where ` V ` is the set of polynomials in ` ( I mPoly R ) ` . This function maps an element of the formal polynomial algebra (with coefficients in ` R ` ) to a function from assignments ` I --> S ` of the variables to elements of ` S ` formed by evaluating the polynomial with the given assignments. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 11-Mar-2015.)
